FAQ

Everything you need to know about Loopdash

Here you can find answers to questions about our creative & digital services. We understand that it can be hard to choose the right company to work with, so we have compiled a list of frequently asked questions to help you decide. If you have any other questions, please contact us.

What is Loopdash?

Loopdash is a design/development practice led by Gary Bunofsky, who oversees creative, dev, and strategy. Loopdash is composed of a selective group of collaborators that contribute to deliver an exceptional project outcomes.

What kind of projects do you work on?

We specialize in WordPress development. Often we find the most value working on web or branding revamps that translate into marketing website projects. We like to collaborate closely with founders or marketing/product leads. Most of our clients hire us for:

  • Brand / Visual Identity
  • Website Design
  • Website Development in WordPress or Webflow
  • Web App Development in Rails or React
  • On-retainer Support (long-term projects where we act as an outsourced dev team)

What does it cost to work with Loopdash?

We prefer to work on a fixed-cost for a majority of our projects. To give an accurate figure, we need to understand your requirements, scope, deliverables and timelines. With that being said, most projects range from $10-20K USD and take around 4-12 weeks to deliver. The minimum level of engagement is currently set at $5K USD.

Who owns the website and deliverables after the project?

Once the project is completed and paid in full you will own all assets and deliverables. We believe in providing our clients with complete ownership of their projects, which includes the website and brand identity.

What are the payment terms?

The payment schedule is broken down into three parts:

  • 50% is due at the very beginning of the project.
  • Another 25% is due at the first milestone, usually when design is approved.
  • The final 25% of the total amount is due when the project is launched.

It's important to note that there are some things that are not included in the project cost. These include:

  • Production costs for printed materials
  • Video or photography purchases
  • Typography or font licenses
  • Media buys, PPC or ad placements
  • Creation of video or photography assets
  • Hosting (this can be discussed before the project is launched)

How do I become a client?

To become a client, please reach out via email to hello@loopdash.com or schedule a time to review your project.

Can you build an app?

We can build anything that runs in the browser. We have built web-based apps that run on mobile, desktop and tablets. We don't do iOS or Android apps.

How do I join Loopdash?

We are actively seeking new collaborators at this tim. Specifically, a Project Manager and a Developer. If you are interested in joining Loopdash, please send us a note at hello@loopdash.com
